overview: The 7176 series features several caseback variations, each representing different models and prototypes within the reference line.

variations.title: 7176 Mk. 1 Caseback
variations.note: The 7176 and 7176 Military casebacks follow the design language change of the caseback first seen on the 7750 Mk. 2 caseback.

list.title: Perimeter Text:
list.text: “7176 CHRONOGRAPH AUTOMATIC WATERRESISTANT TESTED 10 ATM SHOCKPROTECTED STAINLESS STEEL SWISS MADE” in one continuous circle at the perimeter of the back.

list.title: Center Text:
list.text:
The PD logo is accompanied by the words
“PORSCHE DESIGN” curved around it above.

list.title: 7176 Civilian:
list.text:
Serial range is 8 digits and starts with
00xxxxxx and rises sequentially.

list.title: 7176 Military:
list.text:
Serial range is 8 digits and starts with
00xxxxxx and rises sequentially.

variations.title: 7176 D Caseback
variations.note: The 7176 and 7176 Military casebacks follow the design language change of the caseback first seen on the 7750 Mk. 2 caseback.

list.title: 7176 D:
list.text:
Serial range is 8 digits and starts with 2031xxxx
and rises sequentially.

variations.title: 7176 S Caseback
variations.note: The 7176 and 7176 Military casebacks follow the design language change of the caseback first seen on the 7750 Mk. 2 caseback.

list.title: 7176 S:
list.text:
Serial range is 5 or 6 digits with no leading
numbers and rises sequentially.

variations.title: Prototype Caseback
variations.note:
On select 7176 variants, usually those identified as prototypes, a
different caseback has been identified. It features a black acrylic
disk that is embedded into the steel caseback.

list.title: Perimeter Text:
list.text:
“7176 S CHRONOGRAPH AUTOMATIC
WATERRESISTANT TESTED 10 ATM
SHOCKPROTECTED STAINLESS STEEL SWISS MADE”
in one continuous circle at the perimeter of the back.

list.title: Center Text:
list.text:
A sizeable PD logo is accompanied by the
words “PORSCHE DESIGN” curved around it above
